meanings.definition: To put oneself deliberately into a place or situation where one is unwelcome or uninvited.
meanings.sent1: The curious cat kept intruding into the neighbor's garden.
meanings.sent2: Please knock before entering to avoid intruding on their privacy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel intruding into the bird feeder was quite the sight!
meanings.sent4: His loud laughter intruded on the solemn atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the doorbell intruding shattered the peaceful silence.

meanings.definition: To thrust or bring in without invitation, permission, or welcome.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind intruding through the open window made the curtains flutter.
meanings.sent2: The unwanted noise from the party next door intruded into her thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain intruding on our picnic turned it into a water fight!
meanings.sent4: The bright sunlight intruding through the clouds illuminated the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies intruding from the kitchen was irresistible.
